intro: Melissitus squarrosus, commonly known as the roughleaf melissitus, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its yellow flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. The species is noted for its hairy, rough-textured foliage, which gives it its common name.
